com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.validator.pattern
Class UnitValidator

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.validator.pattern.UnitValidator
All Implemented Interfaces:
IUnitValidator
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdditiveUnitValidator, ConfigurationUnitValidator
public class UnitValidator
extends java.lang.Object
implements IUnitValidator

Implements the CorePackage domain validations for a Unit.

Domain validators (DomainValidator) can delegate validations to individual unit validators based on type. This pattern is implemented by UnitDomainValidator.

The main unit validator method IUnitValidator.validate(Unit, IDeployValidationContext, IDeployReporter) delegates validation of the unit-contained entities: requirements, capabilities, links (hosting, requirement, dependency, logical), artifacts.

Unit subtype validators will extend this class to provide domain-specific validations. Two extension mechanisms are provided:

  • "Declarative"-style validators added using
    • addCapabilityTypeConstraint(EClass, CapabilityLinkTypes, int, int): restrict the set of capability types that can be contained by the unit.
    • addRequirementTypeConstraint(EClass, RequirementLinkTypes, int, int) : validate the Requirement.getDmoEType() types that may be required by the unit.
    • addAttributeValidator(IDeployAttributeValidator) : validate an attribute on any contained unit object.
    • addCapabilityValidator(IUnitCapabilityValidator): validate a capability of a specific type.
    • addDependencyLinkValidator(IDependencyLinkValidator): validate a dependency link.
    • addUnitLinkValidator(IUnitLinkValidator): validate a unit link.
    • addConstraintLinkValidator(IConstraintLinkValidator): validate a logical link.
  • Imperative validators added by overriding one of the delegation methods. The core validations may still be applied by invoking super.

public UnitValidator(EClass unitType)
Construct a unit validator for the Unit unit type.

By default, the requirement and capability type constraints are not enforced on undeclared types (@link setAllowUnexpectedCapabilityTypes(boolean)).

Parameters:
unitType - the type of unit that is validated.

addCapabilityTypeConstraint

public void addCapabilityTypeConstraint(EClass type,
                                        CapabilityLinkTypes linkType,
                                        int min,
                                        int max)
Adds a constraint on the types of capabilities that can be provided by the unit.

Parameters:
type - the type that is permitted.
linkType - the link type of the capability (may be null for don't care).
min - the minimum number of type occurances.
max - the maximum number of type occurances.

                                         int min,
                                         int max)
Adds a constraint on the Requirement.getDmoEType() that can be consumed by the unit.

Parameters:
type - the deploy model object type that is permitted.
linkType - the link type that is supported (may be null).
min - the minimum number of type occurances.
max - the maximum number of type occurances.

addAttributeValidator

public void addAttributeValidator(IDeployAttributeValidator validator)
Adds a validator for a deploy model object attribute.

The unit validator checks IDeployAttributeValidator.appliesTo(DeployModelObject, IDeployValidationContext) for each unit contained object that is validated against the attribute validator, and invokes IDeployAttributeValidator.validate(DeployModelObject, IDeployValidationContext, IDeployReporter) when a match is found.

Parameters:
validator - an attribute validator.

addCapabilityValidator

public void addCapabilityValidator(IUnitCapabilityValidator validator)
Adds a validator for a deploy Capability.

For each capability provided by a unit, the unit validator identifies the capability validators of a matching tIUnitCapabilityValidator.getCapabilityType() IDeployAttributeValidator.appliesTo(DeployModelObject, IDeployValidationContext) for each unit contained object that is validated against the attribute validator, and invokes IDeployAttributeValidator.validate(DeployModelObject, IDeployValidationContext, IDeployReporter) when a match is found.

Parameters:
validator - an attribute validator.

validate

public final void validate(Unit unit,
                           IDeployValidationContext context,
                           IDeployReporter reporter)
Validates the unit by delegating to the different protected methods.

Subtypes should never override this method. Generic unit validation should be performed by overriding validateUnit(Unit, IDeployValidationContext, IDeployReporter).

For units in INSTALLED and DO_NOT_PUBLISH state, only the validateInstalledUnit(Unit, IDeployValidationContext, IDeployReporter) protected method will be invoke.

Specified by:
validate in interface IUnitValidator
Parameters:
unit - the unit to be validated.
context - the topology-level validation context (used or indexing).
reporter - used to report errors.
See Also:
com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.validator.IUnitValidator#validate(com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.Unit, com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.validator.IDeployValidationContext, com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.validator.IDeployReporter)

                                          IDeployReporter reporter)
Validates that the group has one member link to each unit.

reporter - used to report validation errors.
